text: there are so many ways that science can
benefit humankind there are so many
horizons of science that I so
enthusiastically welcome in my future
among them are of course medical
advances that make it possible for
people not to lose this great precious
gift we have the human mind this vessel
that we carry our soul our mind our
hearts our aspirations around in could
probably use a little help too by the
same token it's wonderful to imagine
other worlds that are possible to
explore I think the more people people
in creatures people in there I say it
aliens if they were able somehow to
connect and understand more about each
other history has told us that the
knowledge and community are are very
valuable very valuable and and species
preserving instincts and activities it's
funny I almost laughed when I want to
talk about aliens but I think that's the
way my grandmother felt when in high
school she was asked by her teacher born
in 1885 mind you to imagine a wondrous
future and she said I imagine a time
when horseless carriages will fly
through the sky and that teacher the
enemy of science made her sit in a
corner with a dunce cap on and I always
wondered what the look on his face must
have been like when they read a
newspaper and saw that the Wright
brothers flew at Kitty Hawk I always
thought that she'd be vindicated so see
I come from a family of geeks who are
proud of their ability to foresee the
future and one of the reasons I love
doing future escape is that I will be a
part of this investigation into the
cutting edge of science and in my own
small way as an entertainer and as a
science buff I'm going to be able to see
future ideas even if it involves aliens
that people might laugh at the way they
did at my beloved grandmother who
imagine man's lying to the sky and
horses carriages and the dunce in that
case was the teacher who didn't want to
believe the future held possibilities
there
or beyond the human imagination
